CatDescriptText: Related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1967, pg. 13. Portion of accompanying article reads: "Homewood Merchants Face Boycotts - Group Demand Managers Issue Ultimatum - Homewood stores are facing a massive boycott if they fail to hire or upgrade Negroes to managerial positions.  This was the demand of the United Movement for Progress organization, a new Civil Rights organization.  The UNFP, headed by William Haden, a Homewood resident, was formed two months ago and claims 75 members.  The Homewood Chamber of Commerce met with the group last week and agreed to write letters to the chain stores headquarters urging them to comply..."
TitMainTitle: Car passing by Donahoe's supermarket with John's Bargain Stores next door, North Homewood Avenue, Homewood
